lines.line_text: FROM prime of youth to hoary age
In this lone cell I've dwelt;
Here sought, by tracing Nature's page,
To soothe the pangs I felt.

stanzas.stanza_text:
FROM prime of youth to hoary age
In this lone cell I've dwelt;
Here sought, by tracing Nature's page,
To soothe the pangs I felt.

lines.line_text: The moss-wove oaks that near my cave
And o'er its broken summit wave,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The moss-wove oaks that near my cave
In sullen grandeur stand,
And o'er its broken summit wave,
Were acorns in my hand.

lines.line_text: Those time-shook tow'rs, which all forsake,
And half of yon translucent lake,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Those time-shook tow'rs, which all forsake,
Erect, and gay, I've seen;
And half of yon translucent lake,
A flow'r-enamell'd green.

lines.line_text: When shall my penitence and pray'rs
When shall my thorny bed of cares

stanzas.stanza_text:
When shall my penitence and pray'rs
Obtain the boon I crave?
When shall my thorny bed of cares
Become my peaceful grave?

lines.line_text: Nor let it ever backward look

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oh worshipp'd reliques! holy book!
Detain my mental eye;
Nor let it ever backward look
To trace sad memory.

lines.line_text: Or thou! memorial cross of God,
And bow my heart upon the sod,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Or thou! memorial cross of God,
My whole attention seize!
And bow my heart upon the sod,
Worn daily by my knees.

lines.line_text: Nor all her fountains cleanse the steel

stanzas.stanza_text:
Alas! not Piety can heal
The soul convuls'd with guilt;
Nor all her fountains cleanse the steel
Which human blood has spilt.

lines.line_text: Ah! let me ease it then, and speak
What bitter griefs first bade me seek

stanzas.stanza_text:
Ah! let me ease it then, and speak
The long, long treasur'd tale;
What bitter griefs first bade me seek
The silence of this vale.

lines.line_text: Near Cheviot Hills I drew the air
My mother was of presence fair,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Near Cheviot Hills I drew the air
On Aran's pleasant plain;
My mother was of presence fair,
Her sire an aged swain.

lines.line_text: To tend the flocks was my employ,
When my fond mother blest her boy,

stanzas.stanza_text:
To tend the flocks was my employ,
Nor ever heav'd my breast,
When my fond mother blest her boy,
At rising, and at rest.

lines.line_text: Yet oft with tears and smiles she strove,
And as I bent my knee,
She'd cry, "be juster to thy love,
Than mine has been to me."

stanzas.stanza_text:
Yet oft with tears and smiles she strove,
And as I bent my knee,
She'd cry, "be juster to thy love,
Than mine has been to me."

lines.line_text: Yet little note of this I took,
And more admir'd my flow'r-bound crook,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Yet little note of this I took,
Unskill'd in worldly harms,
And more admir'd my flow'r-bound crook,
Than her unequall'd charms.

lines.line_text: The lowly cot, and shepherd's life,
Each night, each morn, she prais'd;
And when they spoke of warlike strife,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The lowly cot, and shepherd's life,
Each night, each morn, she prais'd;
And when they spoke of warlike strife,
With terror on me gaz'd.

lines.line_text: For now the wars of Palestine
While all admir'd the zeal divine,
And with his deeds were fraught.

stanzas.stanza_text:
For now the wars of Palestine
Brave Coeur de Lion fought;
While all admir'd the zeal divine,
And with his deeds were fraught.

lines.line_text: The glorious talk to me was good;
And as it fill'd my ear,
I seem'd to cleave the founding flood,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The glorious talk to me was good;
And as it fill'd my ear,
I seem'd to cleave the founding flood,
Or grasp a fancied spear.

lines.line_text: When, lo! the neighbouring Scots, a band
Rush'd like a whirlwind o'er the land,

stanzas.stanza_text:
When, lo! the neighbouring Scots, a band
Rough as their native rocks,
Rush'd like a whirlwind o'er the land,
And swept away our flocks.

lines.line_text: By many an art my mother try'd
And ev'n her tears were vain.

stanzas.stanza_text:
By many an art my mother try'd
My vengeance to restrain;
But anger argument defy'd,
And ev'n her tears were vain.

lines.line_text: Each swain I bade renounce his crook;
And left them not a choice.
No parle did either party use,
One sought as men who'd all to lose,

stanzas.stanza_text:
No parle did either party use,
Impell'd by fierce disdain;
One sought as men who'd all to lose,
The other to regain.

lines.line_text: Day faintly purpled o'er the sky
But ere our stubborn foes would fly,
The Sun his course had ran.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Day faintly purpled o'er the sky
When the fell fight began;
But ere our stubborn foes would fly,
The Sun his course had ran.

lines.line_text: Thus we retriev'd our fleecy store,
And seem'd, I ween, to love them more,
For all the blows they cost.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Thus we retriev'd our fleecy store,
So late bewail'd as lost,
And seem'd, I ween, to love them more,
For all the blows they cost.

lines.line_text: Not Richard's self his warriors led
Than I for Aran's pastures sped,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Not Richard's self his warriors led
More proudly o'er the deep,
Than I for Aran's pastures sped,
Surrounded by my sheep.

lines.line_text: As nigh I drew, the clouds did roll
The valley flam'd — and my full soul
Died in me at the fight.

stanzas.stanza_text:
As nigh I drew, the clouds did roll
A crimson o'er the night;
The valley flam'd — and my full soul
Died in me at the fight.

lines.line_text: Another band of those who roam
And while we fought to guard our home,
Had made that home a void.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Another band of those who roam
Our hamlet had destroy'd:
And while we fought to guard our home,
Had made that home a void.

lines.line_text: A while I wept, and duteous sought
At length my heart, with vengeance fraught,

stanzas.stanza_text:
A while I wept, and duteous sought
My parents dear remains;
At length my heart, with vengeance fraught,
An useless grief disdains.

lines.line_text: I rouz'd the swains who yet deplor'd
I turn'd my sheep-hook to a sword,

stanzas.stanza_text:
I rouz'd the swains who yet deplor'd
Each desolated field;
I turn'd my sheep-hook to a sword,
My scrip into a shield.

lines.line_text: The savage Scots I swore t'annoy

stanzas.stanza_text:
The savage Scots I swore t'annoy
With ever-loud alarms,
And from a simple shepherd-boy,
Became renown'd in arms.

lines.line_text: Between both lands strong tow'rs I rear
One nation gaz'd on them with fear;

stanzas.stanza_text:
Between both lands strong tow'rs I rear
With captive ensigns bright:
One nation gaz'd on them with fear;
The other with delight.

lines.line_text: Around I station'd many a band,
And ah! one day, by love's command,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Around I station'd many a band,
Who dubious stragglers sought;
And ah! one day, by love's command,
A matchless beauty brought.

lines.line_text: Her mien majestic seem'd to speak
No rose like that on her pure cheek
Blooms o'er the face of sin.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Her mien majestic seem'd to speak
Th' unsullied soul within;
No rose like that on her pure cheek
Blooms o'er the face of sin.

lines.line_text: Oh! not in grace the mountain pine
With her slight form could vye,
The blue that paints the arch divine
Was faint to her bright eye.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oh! not in grace the mountain pine
With her slight form could vye,
The blue that paints the arch divine
Was faint to her bright eye.

lines.line_text: Like a rich group of yellow sheaves,
Play'd on her breast — so Autumn leaves

stanzas.stanza_text:
Like a rich group of yellow sheaves,
In ringlets wild, her hair
Play'd on her breast — so Autumn leaves
Hang on the lily fair.

lines.line_text: Awe-struck, my soul imbib'd a flame
Nor dared I boldly ask the name,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Awe-struck, my soul imbib'd a flame
As virtuous as sincere;
Nor dared I boldly ask the name,
I most desir'd to hear.

Unconscious of her beauty's blaze,
She drew away the shade;
With dignity endur'd my gaze,
And thus to speak essay'd.

lines.line_text: "From brutal hands I seek a friend,
" Nor need I own a Lord.

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Although by force I hither bend
" The captive of thy sword,
"From brutal hands I seek a friend,
" Nor need I own a Lord.

"Of English blood thy servant came,
" Not from a hostile line,
"Lord Ethel is my Father's name,
" And Ethelinda mine.

lines.line_text: "Her sum of days like his are spent,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"To Scotland with my Mother sent,
" A Grandsire's eyes to close,
"Her sum of days like his are spent,
" With him she finds repose.

lines.line_text: " To look in vain for me.

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Ev'n now on silver Severn's side
" My Father anxiously
"Forgets the day my Mother dy'd,
" To look in vain for me.

lines.line_text: "That you yield him with care, and truth,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"By Knighthood's holy laws, oh Youth!
" I therefore claim your gage,
"That you yield him with care, and truth,
" The darling of his age.

lines.line_text: "So may the peace to him you give
"So crown'd with conquest may you live,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"So may the peace to him you give
" With large increase return;
"So crown'd with conquest may you live,
" And glory crown your urn! "

lines.line_text: "Ne'er shall she vainly ask my aid,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Be safe," I cried, "thou lovely Maid;
" By warlike Richard's throne,
"Ne'er shall she vainly ask my aid,
" Whom truth and honor own.

lines.line_text: "To yield thy Sire, with truth, and care,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"By Knighthood's holy laws I swear,
" And give th' unquestion'd gage,
"To yield thy Sire, with truth, and care,
" The darling of his age.

lines.line_text: "To horse, to horse, each vassal knight,
" To hide, and guard, these charms.

stanzas.stanza_text:
"To horse, to horse, each vassal knight,
" Prepare your burnish'd arms;
"Diffuse around a dazzling light,
" To hide, and guard, these charms.

lines.line_text: "A Youth her beauty well might snare,
" Is Man, in love — yet just. "

stanzas.stanza_text:
"A Nymph beyond ev'n Helen fair,
" Bestows a nobler trust;
"A Youth her beauty well might snare,
" Is Man, in love — yet just. "

lines.line_text: And soon my warriors o'er the waste
The Lady in the centre plac'd,

stanzas.stanza_text:
And soon my warriors o'er the waste
In gay profusion roll;
The Lady in the centre plac'd,
Irradiated the whole.

lines.line_text: Still as we journied on, I sought,
T' impress myself on ev'ry thought,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Still as we journied on, I sought,
With love's unconscious art,
T' impress myself on ev'ry thought,
'Till I had won her heart.

lines.line_text: And now my fears would often hint
And wiser 'twere our trust to stint,

stanzas.stanza_text:
And now my fears would often hint
Her Sire might prove unkind,
And wiser 'twere our trust to stint,
But duteous was her mind.

lines.line_text: "Ah doubt not, Edmund," — she would say,
" Nor dare I scorn a father's sway,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Ah doubt not, Edmund," — she would say,
"Thy worth must all engage;
" Nor dare I scorn a father's sway,
"Nor dare I grieve his age.

"His silver'd head, as lilies bow,
" Declining now appears;
"Alike his frame doth tremble now,
" With tenderness and years.

lines.line_text: "And sure a fearful joy she knows

stanzas.stanza_text:
"And sure a fearful joy she knows
" Who unpermitted loves;
"While doubly hallow'd are the vows
" A parent's voice approves. "

lines.line_text: "More fondly draws the heart's dear chain,
"Oh! the sad charm, to know his pain

stanzas.stanza_text:
"More fondly draws the heart's dear chain,
" When watching his decay;
"Oh! the sad charm, to know his pain
" In blessings melts away! "

lines.line_text: Fill'd with her love, sooth'd with her hope,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Fill'd with her love, sooth'd with her hope,
The present hour I blest;
And gave luxuriant fancy scope,
Who more enrich'd the rest.

lines.line_text: When now we reach'd fair Severn's side,
A mountain swell'd with verdant pride,

stanzas.stanza_text:
When now we reach'd fair Severn's side,
Where 'mid her fairest bow'rs,
A mountain swell'd with verdant pride,
Crown'd with Lord Ethel's tow'rs.

lines.line_text: As to the height we gaily wound,
Surpriz'd we heard the drum's fierce sound,

stanzas.stanza_text:
As to the height we gaily wound,
From apprehension free,
Surpriz'd we heard the drum's fierce sound,
Proclaim an enemy.

lines.line_text: Like shining swarms of bees, in arms
And pleasure's notes, and war's alarms,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Like shining swarms of bees, in arms
The Knights now multiply;
And pleasure's notes, and war's alarms,
Our mingling trumpets cry.

lines.line_text: When proud I did the Lady shew, —
More radiant than the vernal bow,
Heav'ns own bright pledge of peace,

stanzas.stanza_text:
When proud I did the Lady shew, —
Who bade all discord cease;
More radiant than the vernal bow,
Heav'ns own bright pledge of peace,

lines.line_text: Her name, in various accents cried,
While the vast portals opening wide,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Her name, in various accents cried,
Was borne away within,
While the vast portals opening wide,
Increas'd the joyful din.

lines.line_text: Forth rush'd, tumultuous as the wind,
But marching with their spears declin'd,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Forth rush'd, tumultuous as the wind,
Knights who no longer frown'd;
But marching with their spears declin'd,
A mute obedience own'd.

lines.line_text: At once, dividing to each side,
And as the swan floats with the tide,

stanzas.stanza_text:
At once, dividing to each side,
Like waves the train retire;
And as the swan floats with the tide,
Slow came the rev'rend Sire.

lines.line_text: The gift of health, an aged bloom,
And white his locks, as erst the plume,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The gift of health, an aged bloom,
His manly cheek confest;
And white his locks, as erst the plume,
That quiver'd o'er his crest.

lines.line_text: The Maid oppress'd with tender pain,
And, than the hart more fleet,
Now graceful shot along the plain,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The Maid oppress'd with tender pain,
And, than the hart more fleet,
Now graceful shot along the plain,
And panted at his feet.

lines.line_text: Have you not seen the fragile rose,
Droop with the gems of morn?
So fair the kneeling Virgin shews,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Have you not seen the fragile rose,
Droop with the gems of morn?
So fair the kneeling Virgin shews,
A Parent's tears adorn.

lines.line_text: Have you not seen the purple vine

stanzas.stanza_text:
Have you not seen the purple vine
With Autumn hoar embost?
Youth with such loveliness divine,
Glows wrapt in age's frost.

lines.line_text: And fast his tears would fall,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Oh most belov'd!" her father cried,
And fast his tears would fall,
"My youth's delight, my age's pride,
" My little earthly all!

lines.line_text: "Thy safe return in peace, and health,
"Thy safe return doth spare my wealth,
" And ah! doth spare my age. "

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Thy safe return in peace, and health,
" Doth all my griefs assuage:
"Thy safe return doth spare my wealth,
" And ah! doth spare my age. "

lines.line_text: He said, and turning to a Knight,

stanzas.stanza_text:
He said, and turning to a Knight,
Upon whose brow serene,
Sat grace attemper'd with delight,
While valor mark'd his mien.

"See, Baron," added he, "thy Bride;
" My child, behold the Son,
"Allotted for thy Lord, and guide,
" When thy fond father's gone.

"Ah venerate that hallow'd shield,
" Upon whose orb the cross,
"Declares, in many a well-fought field,
" The Saracens vast loss.

"With grateful love accept the hand,
" But for whose aid, forlorn,
"And fatherless, thou now mightst stand,
" Nor I hail thy return. "

lines.line_text: soul, as with an ague shook,
At once both froze and burn'd;
When she, not deigning  a look,

stanzas.stanza_text:
soul, as with an ague shook,
At once both froze and burn'd;
When she, not deigning  a look,
All tearful to me turn'd.

"Behold," she faltering said, "the sword
" Which set thy daughter free;
"Approve a heart where I'm ador'd —
" Where I alone would be. —

lines.line_text: "Could I from duty have been won,
"I should have call'd this Knight thy son,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Could I from duty have been won,
" His honor to reward,
"I should have call'd this Knight thy son,
" And claim'd a like regard.

lines.line_text: "Oh! think, tho' fortune freed his will,
"Oh! rise above the thought of ill —

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Oh! think, tho' fortune freed his will,
" With reverence he woo'd;
"Oh! rise above the thought of ill —
" Remember gratitude. —

lines.line_text: " Your pow'r may bid me weep —
"But tears, like falling drops on stone,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"That claim I never will disown;
" Your pow'r may bid me weep —
"But tears, like falling drops on stone,
" The heart's-wound wear more deep.  "—

lines.line_text: The Baron's eyes blaz'd thro' the snow
And red his haughty blushes glow,
While thus he speaks his ire.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The Baron's eyes blaz'd thro' the snow
Of age, with Hecla's fire;
And red his haughty blushes glow,
While thus he speaks his ire.

lines.line_text: "And who then art thou, nameless Youth?
" Which dyes thy cheek with nature's truth,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"And who then art thou, nameless Youth?
From whence deriv'd that flood,
" Which dyes thy cheek with nature's truth,
"And vies with Ethel's blood?

lines.line_text: "Where are the honors of thy line?
"Which thou presum'st to blend with mine,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Where are the honors of thy line?
" Unblazon'd on thy arms;
"Which thou presum'st to blend with mine,
" Vain of ignoble charms. —

lines.line_text: "Knowst thou, the spoils of many a Knight
"Knowst thou the lands within thy sight,
" This Maid will one day own?

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Knowst thou, the spoils of many a Knight
" Descend to me alone?
"Knowst thou the lands within thy sight,
" This Maid will one day own?

lines.line_text: "Learn, Youth, to ask some fit reward,
"And fame, and wealth, and high regard,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Learn, Youth, to ask some fit reward,
" Which with thy rank agrees;
"And fame, and wealth, and high regard,
" Thy anger shall appease. "

"Hold, Lord," I cried, "nor meanly boast,
" Degraded ancestry;
"Thy honors in thyself are lost,
" While mine begin in me.

lines.line_text: "But let us prove this vaunted blood,
" Nerve not his arm like thine.

stanzas.stanza_text:
"But let us prove this vaunted blood,
" This elevated line;
"And see if Edmund's humble flood,
" Nerve not his arm like thine.

lines.line_text: "For while firm youth shall brace his hand,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"For while firm youth shall brace his hand,
" And love his ardent heart,
"The matchless Maid he will demand,
" Who forms its dearest part.

lines.line_text: "Come then, ye knights, your well-tried arms

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Come then, ye knights, your well-tried arms
" In deadly wrath produce,
"While ours, unwrought for such alarms,
" Gain strength alone from use. "

lines.line_text: Alost I wav'd my sword of pow'r,
And like the Guard of Eden's bow'r,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Alost I wav'd my sword of pow'r,
The spiral lustre run,
And like the Guard of Eden's bow'r,
Flam'd to the noon-day sun.

lines.line_text: While thus we met, with equal ire,

stanzas.stanza_text:
While thus we met, with equal ire,
Before my sorrowing eyes,
The proud inexorable Sire
Bore off the beauteous prize.

lines.line_text: Oh! if ye ever knew to melt
I need not paint the pangs I felt,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oh! if ye ever knew to melt
In passion's tender glow,
I need not paint the pangs I felt,
At this extreme of woe.

lines.line_text: Oh! if ye ever yet have rag'd,
Ye well will guess the war we wag'd,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oh! if ye ever yet have rag'd,
Oppress'd by savage pow'r,
Ye well will guess the war we wag'd,
The fierceness of that hour.

lines.line_text: The sun unheeded veil'd his head,
While many a casque was riv'n;
And that last darkness seem'd to spread,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The sun unheeded veil'd his head,
While many a casque was riv'n;
And that last darkness seem'd to spread,
Which mingles earth with heav'n.

lines.line_text: Yet still in mortal conflict join'd,
'Till oft, by heaven's wild fires, we find
A friend slain for a foe.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Yet still in mortal conflict join'd,
No respite we allow,
'Till oft, by heaven's wild fires, we find
A friend slain for a foe.

Humanity at length o'er pride
Prevail'd, and sooth'd this heat;
We deem'd, 'till day-light should decide,
'Twere valour to retreat.

lines.line_text: But on the morn, at Ethel's word,

stanzas.stanza_text:
But on the morn, at Ethel's word,
Lord-marcher of the land,
Indignant thousands on us pour'd,
Nor could we more withstand.

lines.line_text: My Knights, despoil'd of armor, peace
My sword alone they dar'd not seize;
What then was all my early fame!
What then, alas! even virtue's flame!

stanzas.stanza_text:
What then was all my early fame!
The wealth by valor giv'n!
What then, alas! even virtue's flame!
Th' united gifts of heav'n!

lines.line_text: Lost to my heart its only joy,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Lost to my heart its only joy,
Extinct at once its flights;
Sad images my days employ,
And sadder still my nights.

lines.line_text: The bridal feast approach'd, the vests
To many a fair were shewn,
Full was the Baron's hall of guests,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The bridal feast approach'd, the vests
To many a fair were shewn,
Full was the Baron's hall of guests,
Myself forbid alone.

lines.line_text: All hope now lost, I wild arose,

stanzas.stanza_text:
All hope now lost, I wild arose,
And soon within the bound,
Where piety adores the cross,
My feet unconscious found.

lines.line_text: A dreary eye around I cast,
And own'd it as my knell.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Impell'd by destiny, I past
When struck the vesper bell, —
A dreary eye around I cast,
And own'd it as my knell.

lines.line_text: When lo! approaching fast, the tread
I turn'd, and as by justice led,

stanzas.stanza_text:
When lo! approaching fast, the tread
Of warlike steps I heard,
I turn'd, and as by justice led,
My Rival there appear'd.

With wonder, blessing ev'ry shrine,
I drew the well-worn blade,
"One moment yet," I cried, "is mine —
" Deserve, or lose the Maid. "

lines.line_text: And long the vict'ry doubtful hung,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Impetuous love each sinew strung,
As we by turns assail'd;
And long the vict'ry doubtful hung,
But oh! my fate prevail'd.

lines.line_text: At length, between th' ill-jointed mail,
Fast rush'd the stream of life, and pale

stanzas.stanza_text:
At length, between th' ill-jointed mail,
My sword a passage found,
Fast rush'd the stream of life, and pale
He dropt upon the ground.

lines.line_text: While sighs of rage from his proud breast
A thousand pangs his eye confest,

stanzas.stanza_text:
While sighs of rage from his proud breast
Impell'd the vital flood,
A thousand pangs his eye confest,
Beyond the waste of blood.

lines.line_text: "Call to your aid the pow'r divine,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Ignoble Lord," I cried, "she's mine,
" On holy land you lie —
"Call to your aid the pow'r divine,
" Repent, before you die. "

"Ah, say'st thou?" groan'd he, "
" 'Twas there my sins began;
"For thither, heedless of command,
" In early youth I ran. "

lines.line_text: "And left the charm of ev'ry eye

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Broke too the unacknowledg'd tye
" An humble love had made;
"And left the charm of ev'ry eye
" In infamy to fade.

"Alas! perhaps on Aran's plain
" She yet exists forlorn!
"With Albert's heir, a fancied swain,
" From lineal honors torn.

"To Basil's daughter, my true bride,
" This ring restore again. —
"To Basil's daughter!" I replied,
"What, Emma of the plain?"

lines.line_text: He groan'd assent — thro' all my frame

stanzas.stanza_text:
He groan'd assent — thro' all my frame
Did cold convulsions run —
"You see," I falter'd, "void of name,
" That miserable son —

lines.line_text: He bent to earth his head:
"Oh do not more than kill me, boy!"

stanzas.stanza_text:
"The murder'd Emma's only joy" —
He bent to earth his head:
"Oh do not more than kill me, boy!"
All-agoniz'd he said.

lines.line_text: "Yet while I've strength the truth to groan,
"Bid here the Monks, that I may own
" In you, my heir, my son. "

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Yet while I've strength the truth to groan,
" To yonder convent run,
"Bid here the Monks, that I may own
" In you, my heir, my son. "

lines.line_text: And forth the holy Fathers wound,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Already did th' unwonted sound
The vesper rites restrain;
And forth the holy Fathers wound,
A venerable train.

lines.line_text: And list with hallow'd zeal afar,

stanzas.stanza_text:
With consecrated lights they star
The bosom of the earth,
And list with hallow'd zeal afar,
The blessing of our birth.

lines.line_text: Before the cross the dying Lord,
In silence first his God ador'd,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Before the cross the dying Lord,
With penitential awe,
In silence first his God ador'd,
And mourn'd his broken law:

lines.line_text: Then raising to the Monks his eyes,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Then raising to the Monks his eyes,
Where life's last lustre play'd,
"Suspend these sacred rites," he cries,
'Till I deserve your aid. —

lines.line_text: "If struggling thus with shame and death,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"If struggling thus with shame and death,
" I dare avow a truth,
"Confirm'd by my expiring breath,
" Oh vindicate this Youth!

lines.line_text: "Inform my Liege, that led by pride,
"In early youth I chose a bride,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Inform my Liege, that led by pride,
" Yet by fond passion won,
"In early youth I chose a bride,
" I ever scorn'd to own.

lines.line_text: "With impious zeal, the band I join'd
"And with false glory fir'd my mind,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"With impious zeal, the band I join'd
" He led to Palestine,
"And with false glory fir'd my mind,
" T' elude the wrath divine.

lines.line_text: "With him a prison's gloom I shar'd,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"With him I ev'ry danger dar'd,
" Which mark'd the proud crusade;
"With him a prison's gloom I shar'd,
" Nor selt my soul upbraid. —

lines.line_text: "While in our Northern wilds was born
"Has from its seat that being torn,
" Which gave him first to be —

stanzas.stanza_text:
"While in our Northern wilds was born
" This Youth, whose energy
"Has from its seat that being torn,
" Which gave him first to be —

lines.line_text: "Since justly then, in flow'r of health,
"Oh may he give my heir my wealth,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Since justly then, in flow'r of health,
" I expiate thus my pride,
"Oh may he give my heir my wealth,
" My name — alas, my Bride!

lines.line_text: "To save his soul from endless fire,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Unhappy Boy! if for thy fire
" These streaming sorrows flow,
"To save his soul from endless fire,
" Perennial pray'rs bestow. "

lines.line_text: He died — nor had I time to think
On all I'd lost, or won, —

stanzas.stanza_text:
He died — nor had I time to think
On all I'd lost, or won, —
I hover'd on creation's brink,
And clung to love alone.

lines.line_text: The busy Monks remov'd the corse,
When fraud effected, what nor force,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The busy Monks remov'd the corse,
The arms alone remain'd;
When fraud effected, what nor force,
Nor supplication gain'd.

lines.line_text: And soon the hostile mountain scale,
Where now the gates flew wide.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Incumber'd with Lord Albert's mail,
A desperate hope I try'd,
And soon the hostile mountain scale,
Where now the gates flew wide.

lines.line_text: The high-arch'd halls I safely past,
Where echo to the midnight blast
Sigh'd wild, and loud as me.

stanzas.stanza_text:
The high-arch'd halls I safely past,
Thro' lucid heraldry,
Where echo to the midnight blast
Sigh'd wild, and loud as me.

'Till the lone gallery now appear'd
Enrich'd with pond'rous mail,
Where many a banner, time-endear'd,
Slow rustled to the gale.

Upon its gilded sides pourtray'd,
Magnificently old,
Each ancestor's distinguish'd shade
Gave lustre to the gold.

lines.line_text: The snowy plumes appear to wave,
Defend the honors which they gave,

stanzas.stanza_text:
The snowy plumes appear to wave,
And arms, and forms divine,
Defend the honors which they gave,
Or deify the line.

lines.line_text: On me all seem to turn their eyes
Then, like the rainbow's transient dyes,

stanzas.stanza_text:
On me all seem to turn their eyes
Prophetic with my doom,
Then, like the rainbow's transient dyes,
They melt into a gloom.

lines.line_text: Where tapers shed a quiv'ring gleam,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Beyond — all open — silent — dim —
The length'ning rooms extend,
Where tapers shed a quiv'ring gleam,
Each moment strove to end.

lines.line_text: With bold despair I thither past,
'Till ent'ring, with rude step, the last,

stanzas.stanza_text:
With bold despair I thither past,
My sate's extremes to prove;
'Till ent'ring, with rude step, the last,
I saw my long-lost love.

lines.line_text: Careless she view'd those arms so fam'd,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Careless she view'd those arms so fam'd,
Nor once remov'd her eyes;
"Rests Ethelinda," I exclaim'd,
"While ruin'd Edmund dies?

lines.line_text: "But Hymen's torch is quench'd in blood,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Or tir'd of having thus withstood,
" Resolves she on a crime?
"But Hymen's torch is quench'd in blood,
" And yielded up to time. "

"By miracle since thou art come,"
She falter'd out, "t' attest
" With heav'n my melancholy doom,
"I trust to that the rest.

"Unjust and cruel — if you knew —
" What, doubt my passion yet?
"Edmund, this heart, forever true,
" Could break, but not forget.

lines.line_text: "Each blush which deepen'd on my cheek,
"Oh learn to think that passion weak,

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Each blush which deepen'd on my cheek,
" Declar'd my love's excess;
"Oh learn to think that passion weak,
" Which language can express —

lines.line_text: "And when the last fond crimson flies
" And own my love — in death.

stanzas.stanza_text:
"And when the last fond crimson flies
" With my expiring breath,
"Then, then, allow the sacrifice,
" And own my love — in death.

lines.line_text: "Alas! ev'n now that hour is come —
" For think not I would be,
" A Bride, and not to thee. "

stanzas.stanza_text:
"Alas! ev'n now that hour is come —
" For think not I would be,
"While herbs afford a mortal bloom,
" A Bride, and not to thee. "

lines.line_text: While yet she spoke, the roseate hue,
Which on her soft cheek play'd,
And her bright eyes celestial blue

stanzas.stanza_text:
While yet she spoke, the roseate hue,
Which on her soft cheek play'd,
And her bright eyes celestial blue
Began apace to fade.

lines.line_text: As she ev'n then were dead.

stanzas.stanza_text:
O'er her transparent tender skin
An icy polish spread;
A nerveless torpor crept within,
As she ev'n then were dead.

lines.line_text: More cold, and cold, that heart now grew,
More slow, and slow, her breath she drew,

stanzas.stanza_text:
More cold, and cold, that heart now grew,
Which gave such rich supplies;
More slow, and slow, her breath she drew,
'Till it was nought but sighs.

lines.line_text: And now, beyond the grief of thought —
She seem'd a beauteous statue, wrought
To grace her own sad tomb.

stanzas.stanza_text:
And now, beyond the grief of thought —
And now devoid of bloom —
She seem'd a beauteous statue, wrought
To grace her own sad tomb.

lines.line_text: O'er the fair form, tho' dead,
Fond fancy's wish, vain reason's boast,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Astounded — hopeless — reckless — lost —
O'er the fair form, tho' dead,
Fond fancy's wish, vain reason's boast,
My heart in silence bled —

lines.line_text: No voice its solitude could break —
Not ev'n her sire's complaints could wake

stanzas.stanza_text:
No voice its solitude could break —
No object win my eye —
Not ev'n her sire's complaints could wake
A keener agony.

lines.line_text: Alas! to him who caus'd the grief,
A sudden, and a long relief,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Alas! to him who caus'd the grief,
Relenting fortune gave
A sudden, and a long relief,
In Ethelinda's grave.

lines.line_text: The Monks Lord Albert's will assert —
When did they know a breaking heart

stanzas.stanza_text:
The Monks Lord Albert's will assert —
The King allow'd my claim —
When did they know a breaking heart
Revive upon a name?

lines.line_text: To all these comforters my soul,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Impatient of the proud controul,
And thankless for each care,
To all these comforters my soul,
Sigh'd only out — despair —

lines.line_text: Wild as these woods, in them to mourn

stanzas.stanza_text:
Of ev'ry human hope forlorn,
All-desolate I ran,
Wild as these woods, in them to mourn
The miseries of Man.

lines.line_text: Oft on the hill, the hunters hear
And turn aside with holy fear,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Oft on the hill, the hunters hear
The sadly vocal gale,
And turn aside with holy fear,
Nor dare the copse assail.

lines.line_text: Ev'n the wild deer, with look profound,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Ev'n the wild deer, with look profound,
My sorrows seem to share,
And ev'ry groaning tree around
But echoes my despair —

lines.line_text: Catch life from my wild brain. —

stanzas.stanza_text:
'Till sometimes, thought's aërial brood,
A wan, and num'rous train,
Fantastic sons of solitude,
Catch life from my wild brain. —

lines.line_text: Full threescore times the frosts have bound
All streams but from these eyes,
Since here my care-worn limbs first found

stanzas.stanza_text:
Full threescore times the frosts have bound
All streams but from these eyes,
Since here my care-worn limbs first found
A refuge from the skies.

lines.line_text: Years upon years thus slowly roll,
Since ev'n in sleep my active soul

stanzas.stanza_text:
Years upon years thus slowly roll,
Nor comfort bring to me,
Since ev'n in sleep my active soul
Lives o'er her misery.

lines.line_text: Dim are my days, and near the hour
When death at length is mine;
Which only can my bliss restore,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Dim are my days, and near the hour
When death at length is mine;
Which only can my bliss restore,
Or bid me ne'er repine.

lines.line_text: Ye generous poor, who send me bread,
Your little offspring find me dead,

stanzas.stanza_text:
Ye generous poor, who send me bread,
When on my rushy couch,
Your little offspring find me dead,
With pious hearts approach —

lines.line_text: Hide me in earth, and consecrate
So may you ever 'scape the fate

stanzas.stanza_text:
Hide me in earth, and consecrate
With tears this simple tale,
So may you ever 'scape the fate
Of Edmund of the Vale.
